Description: Mould-made terracotta lamp-holder in the form of bust of the youthful Dionysos on plinth. The bust is supported by a globe and is draped; bunches of grapes at chest. The hair is curly around front of head, and indicated by impressions at the back. Above, a suspension-handle of the notched Egyptian type. At rear, rectangular opening for the introduction of a lamp; several holes pierced in plinth and bust, and in the head at the rear, allowed the light to be seen. Brown, micaceous clay. Plaster mould.
Curator's comments: Lamp-holders with similar piercing: Breccia, E., 1930. ‘Terrecotte figurate greche e Greco-Egizie del Museo di Alessandria’ I. Bergamo : Officine dell'Istituto italiano d'arti grafiche, pl. xxxi, 3, a seated grotesque; ‘Archäologischer Anzeiger’ 1918, p. 129, fig. 15, a seated child grotesque, from Alexandria; Hayes, J.W., 1980. ‘Ancient lamps in the Royal Ontario Museum’. Toronto : Royal Ontario Museum, 565, a dramatic mask, from the Fayum.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2001)
